It's not chewing gum, doing tensor calculus and riding a skateboard on a humpback whale during breeching season, but it's a little harder than, say, hitting the snooze button on your clock.- it really sticks, and without anything sticky.  See CONS below.CONS:IF you use postits for shopping lists (or a day planner.  just ask me), and you put it in the same pocket as your iPhone, DON'T!  The reason post-its are so popular, the reason they work so well, is that the adhesive doesn't work that well.  Believe me, it does.  It sticks to this film like love-bugs on a radiator in summer. (oblique living in hell - um, Florida - reference there, no offense meant).  The post-it comes off, the adhesive stays.  It's a real bear to remove, too.  IF you use a strip of cellophane tape (scotch or box), the film comes right off the screen first.  Again, I pressed it down and then peeled off the tape and postit residue obliquely in the same plane as the film.  worked fine.  And again, no dust under the screen.LESSONS LEARNED:a 1/2 inch piece of tape will effectively peel back the film without damaging it if you need to get that speck of dust out from under the film.  But make sure your house is full of dog, bird and lizard dander and dust mites and pollen before even trying to apply this, or you might get a single speck somewhere that'll bug the heck out of you for years (or the next generation comes along).This is a good product, and cheaper here (no tax or shipping, either) than at the Apple Store.  You got an iPhone?  Buy this.
summary: You won't even know it's there, but you will if it isn't.

reviewText: Excellent and Ergonomic Design. Easy to Break Though!I bought this holder three times over the last 12 months. I like its design as it is the best-fit onto my auto vintelation to hold my iPhone. I rely on it on every single trip to listen to audio through the AUX cable, navigate to a POI, and also charge it while driving.However, what I don't like about it is that its arms easily break. I tried many times to glue them but they still break easily afterwards.I still haven't seen a better holder.
summary: Excellent and Ergonomic Design. Easy to Break Though!Excellent and Ergonomic Design. Easy to Break Though!  I bought this holder

reviewText: it worked better than i expected. i had one that hooked to the vent before but it didn't hold the way this one did.i guess it is because  it is spring loaded.
Worked as expected.  Price was good.  Easy to install.  The device needs to be readjusted every so often as it does loosen after numerous miles but  really not a problem

The holder itself is fine, but beware that the text and pictures used with the product are not accurate.  The text describes and the pictures show items not actually included in the package.  Specifically, the AMPS mounting plate -square plastic piece with four holes in the corners- is NOT in the box.  That part is specifically why I wanted this holder and now I will have to order it separately even though is is supposed to be included.The holder itself seems fine.  I've used Bracketron before and this is more or less a typical Bracketron holder.Unfortunately, I need that AMPS plate.  If your car is outfitted for AMPS like mine, just be prepared to spend more money and time acquiring that one little part that should be included per the item description.
summary: Beware, the text and pictures are not accurate. NO AMPS plate in the box.

reviewText: Fits on car air vent quite securely and holds my iPhone 5S very well.  Easy to secure and remove the phone from the holder.  Can adjust the holder to hold the phone in a good viewing position.  Very pleased with this purchase.

Generally I like this bracket, although not as much as some others.  My biggest annoyance is that you have to pump the release button like 1 million times to get the brackets to expand.  Fix that please

Horrible device - I had purchased 3 of these from various sources - one from Amazon - guess what  2 of the three have broken - one at the joint behind the holder - and one of the devices jaws came open while driving dropping my expensive device.Just a poor buying and using experience.
summary: Avoid at all costs - very prone to breakage - and may drop your phone too.

reviewText: The little lever to push in, which adjusts the width, only does its job about 1/3 of the time. The other times I just push it in vain.

reviewerName: D. Deutsch "Chance favors the prepared mind."
reviewText: I bought several of these mounts at a local RadioShack for a little over twice the price so I think that this is a great deal on Amazon. This mount has worked very well across various Nissans. Installation has been easy although removal requires some patience.  This device has held iPhones and GPSes in portrait ad landscape mode without complaint.  They tend to break after about a year or so, but the design is overall excellent and I felt that this product served me well. If it felt more substantial and lasted a bit longer I would rate this unit 5 stars.

I'm only being honest people... complete utter junk! With all the other things out there I should have never purchased this. I was in a rush so I jumped to a bad item. All phone are different so I will give you this tip: get something that you can mount to your dashboard with double side white foam tape. However, don't install it in the middle of the dash. If possible fix it to the drivers left side corner of the dash. Now it is out of the line of sight for distractions.As for this thing... it shakes, it rattles, it makes all kinds of noise and the weight of a smart phone was just to much for it.
ok product good buy for the price but the tension springs that hold it to the vent keep popping out if it is moved at all

i thought for $8 these were a good deal, but they are uber-cheap!  the spring-loaded vent clips only attach on the top of the unit, and the thicker vents on my jeep cause them to pop off occasionally.  also, the bottom of the mount doesn't attach at all, so every time you hit a bump in the car, the phone and mount flop around...poor design, if you need a vent mount look elsewhere!

This holds my 5'5" Note 2 as well as my wife's iPhone 4.  Don't have to buy different holder for different phone.  If it lasts long, I don't have to buy new one when I have to replace any of our phones.  I have placed in each of my cars.  Feels kind of flimsy, but maybe it's because it's placed on vent, not a sturdy area to begin with, but does the job.  Good thing is, it won't leave marks on my window or dashboard.
I like bracketron. this is my second one and I actually took off the vent connectors and attached it with double sided tape. Works great.
Product works great. I saw some people complaining that they couldn't rotate their phone while it was in the holder, but I didn't have a problem with that.
THIS LITTLE GUY IS MUCH BEEFIER THAN YOU WOULD EXPECT BUT NOT TO BULKY. Works great and hold my Iphone 5 in place at all angles. No complaints. The price is well worth it!
summary: BUILD FORD TUFF -WELL HONDA THAT IS

reviewText: Doesn't work for driver side in tundra because of steering column shifter and not too well in cars with funky vents, like the 2007 honda accord we have.But it rocks in our subaru outback 2004 and our 2010 sienna (and prior 2000 sienna).  We have it on driver and passenger side of some cars.Go ahead and order some replacement vent clips from the manufacturer website.  Clips could be sturdier.Definitely a buy recommendation.
summary: We own 5 of these; they are pretty good

reviewText: The design is okay, but the whole thing is made from really cheap plastic.The ball joint mechanism is really hard to move and adjust.The ball joint has a plastic cylindrical protusion that attaches to the holder.  That part broke, it is weak and thin.  If they were gonna make the most important joint thin, then they should've made it out of metal, not cheap plastic.
One of the best air vent holder that I bought--and I have tried a lot--  just needs some more stability to have a five star.

I guess the third time's the charm!  I tried both the USA Gear Universal Car Air / AC Vent Mount XL and the Mountek nGroove Universal CD Slot Mount.  The USA Gear mount would not hold the phone with my Ionic Guardian Case and Mountek sat too far away for me to be able to see the screen clearly since I use it as a GPS (although I really like that one as it was very sturdy).  However, this one is great!  The spring clips grab onto the vents and hold it in place.  Note that the mount will move a up and down a bit if you move it since the base support just leans against the bottom of the vent but that's okay.  One thing that I really like about this mount is the release button.  There's only one button and it's on the bottom right.  This makes it very easy to quickly detach the phone with one hand.  On other mounts you may have to reach around the back and use two hands which can be quite tedious.  So far I've only had this mount a few days but I'm very impressed.
summary: Works Great for Samsung Galaxy Note 2 with Case

reviewText: I use it everyday in my 2011 Civic coupe for a couple of months now and have had no problems. I also like the ability to swivel the cradle so you can adjust for your phone better viewing.  I have the iphone 5 with otterbox and it fits good.  The photo doesn't show it, but it has two 'feet' that fold out to hold the bottom of the phone from sliding out.
Fits really well in my vent! I have an old Honda Passport and I was surprised this holder was able to fit well. I'm getting another one for my wifes car now!

I guess its a crap shoot when you buy cheap, but since a Lot of the reviews were positive I decided to give it a try. Unfortunately the"Spring loaded locking mechanism"  did not work on this one, making it effectively useless
summary: flimzy, unstable and does not work

reviewText: Unless you hit the sweet spot in installation the holder fits awkwardly and doesn't feel sturdy. I would recommend going with an air vent mount or a CD slot mount.

The material is a bit flimsy, wonder how long it'll last, but it is able to hold my iphone 5 up without a problem.  One caution when you install, be careful when you insert the grasping fingers into your air vent.  I managed to strip the up/down gearing inside the vent since once you install the Bracketron, the position becomes fixed and when you try to shift the air vent up/down, it will strip since the position of one of the up/down blade is fixed...
summary: Useful, but could've been a bit stronger

reviewText: I bought this in a never-ending battle to find a way to mount my iPhone on the dash of my car, mostly for using GPS. I'm always looking... I've since found a better, hanging solution, but I used this holder for a time with mixed results.The phone fits in the brackets just fine. That's not a problem. And it does grip the vents tightly. I just couldn't get the thing to sit at a usable angle. And truth be told, I've never liked the vent idea. It basically means you can't use that vent all winter -- heat blasting at my iPhone isn't something I recommend -- and for those of us that live up north, sometimes it's just too cold to give up your closest source of heat.

Carry Case, Blackberry Vinyl Pocket Case / B001B38LUGMy Blackberry came with this case, and I was distraught when I lost it. This pocket case on Amazon is a perfect replacement, identical in every way to the one that came with my Blackberry.The case is snug and the Blackberry is never in danger of falling out. The screen is protected inside, from scratches and cuts, and the design makes it simple to grasp the Blackberry to pull it in and out of the case when needed. There is no clip on the back, so this won't hook to a belt or the outside of a purse, but this case will definitely keep your Blackberry safe inside your purse or pocket.~ Ana Mardoll

This Blackberry "Pocket Pouch" is exactly what I needed to replace one that was lost some time ago. This case is indistinguishable from the one that came with Blackberry Curve 8330.Like the original case, it does have the sleep function that saves battery power by putting my Blackberry into standby mode when it is in the case.I'm glad that this case was available since it was less than optimal to carry my Blackberry around in my pocket without it.Highly Recommended!CFH

I use this for my Palm Pixi Plus and it fits well.  My phone sticks out a bit more than I like but no big deal.  I do not like the piece with the blackberry logo on it.  I think it makes the pocket case looks worse.
This item came quickly and was as described.  I had to replace my other case due to my dog chewing it up.  I'm quite satisfied with the item and plus it was cheap!!!
Excellent price and quality.  It'd be better only if someone can provide one that you can't loose
This case is good quality and arrived on time will be a good standby when I need to protect my phone doing a task.

As other reviewers have stated, this is the exact OEM case that comes with the BlackBerry Curve 8300 series. There is a good reason this is included with the original phone, it has important functions that will increase not only your phone's life, but your battery life as well. The magnet in the case (make sure the phone is facing so that you can see the front through the little notch) puts the phone in sleep mode. Without that, the phone will constantly be being activated when you move around, and the battery goes pretty quick. In addition to this, you can set a custom ring tone profile for when it's in its holster.The snug fit and sturdy construction protect the phone - I gave my old 8300 to my son with a cool-looking (and expensive) Body Glove pouch (BIG mistake!) and within a month the screen was cracked. Other cases/pouches/shells, even ones that cost 5 times as much as this does with shipping, will NOT protect your BlackBerry like this OEM case.If I'd given him the OEM case and not that stylish, fancy one, I would not have just spent $130 on the insurance deductible.
summary: If you have the 8300 series BlackBerry, you NEED this case

reviewText: I purchased this case as a replacement for the case my dog chewed up.  While I have no doubt that this is an OEM product (my wife recently purchased a BlackBerry Curve that shipped with the exact same case), I have to say that it is of a lower quality than the case that came with the BlackBerry I purchased more than a year ago.  The vinyl is thinner, it puckers along the seams (especially on the bottom), and, instead of having a nice rubbery coating, the edges are rough.  This case will do the job (and the price was right) but I won't miss it when I finally replace my phone.
summary: Cheap Materials but Does the Job

reviewText: Love the case. Great Price. Phone doesnt slide out of the case easily also no too tight to get out of the case.
This is exactly what I wanted. It came very fast from Accessory One.  Price was great (cheaper than the shipping).  What else can i say? i will definitely do business with them again.
This thing is ok. I mean, it charges my phone which is what it's supposed to do. The only thing I don't like is that sometimes I have the play with it a bit to get it to retract.

well the golden rule always works - you get what you paid for. Wouldn't retract after 3-4 times. too think to fit your iPhone if it have protective case. Otherwise works great  :) Will make great garage sell item
its a good cord that does what you need it to do but you can tell it's cheaply made and the sticker on the side of it isn't even in the exact center, it's awkward looking.
summary: good charging cable, sort of cheaply made

reviewText: I travel often, this cable stays in the bag the entire time. No need to loop it, it does it all for you. I bought 3 and all 3 cables works as designed. Great price!

Product does what it is suppose to but I was buying also because the picture showed a smaller connector that goes into the iPhone.  This way I could keep on my iPhone case. With this product  have to remove the case to use the cable because the connector is much wider than the normal Apple connector
summary: Serves the Purpose but not what was in the picture

reviewText: Love this. The retractable design protects these from getting crimped, broken and frayed. Great for company use. Sometimes the iPhone is finicky about recognizing the device and charging, so it helps to plug in and unplug the USB a time or two to get it to charge.

I purchased two of these and totally love it. It feels sturdy and is really convenient, especially when charging my iPhone with a laptop. I also contacted the seller about the tracking number and they got back to me right away. Very happy with this product and would definitely recommend.

This is the perfect solution for those of us with pesty pets that chew. The cable can be fully or partially extended, leaving less wire to tempt kitty. The quality is acceptable, although some of the USB plugs fit loosely and occasionally the sync/charge will stop.  Just unplug & plug in again. Be sure to get at least 2, one for charging & the other for syncing. And you will have a spare when kitty decides to hide one. Now, if I could just get her to stop chewing holes in my shirts.  She only eats shirts with pockets.  Every shirt has holes at the top corner of each pocket. She is a very clever cat.  Oops, back to the review.  The price is right, delivery is quick & it works with the 3GS. I've bought 3 & they all work fine, except for the one that's gone missing.
summary: My cat ate my iphone cable

reviewText: I paid about $3.00 each for these (and I bought 3 of them). They work perfectly. I was able to charge and sync my iPad and iPod Nano. For a $3.00 product, the quality is good. The winding mechanism works well (although I do wish there was a button that you can push and it'll wind itself up like my Micro USB, but then again I paid $10.00 for it). I had no problem with the iPad/iPod connector as the cases I used did not get in the way.Shipping was reasonable, and the item arrived in under three days from the vendor (I think because they were local).
A good product.  A little flimsy, but I don't use it a lot, only when I travel.  And it does the job when I need it.

I have bought a few of these in the past. They work ok for the most part. After a lot of usage the cable can become weak and eventually break. But you can't beat the ease of use of the retractable cord. I throw one or two in bag for use on the road. Can't beat the price. Also keep searching for the one that offers free delivery. With free delivery the price is nothing and you can afford to get a few.
The charger part worked nicely for some time, but the retractable part broke after a while, not very sturdy, but we got great use out of it.
summary: Nice but does not last long

reviewerName: Knife Knut "Just my opinion, take it for what...
reviewText: My only real issue with this item is that I was not able to charge my device while it was in its case.

I'm glad I bought this, as I could keep my iPod plugged in and leave it in my compartment in my car without having a cord sticking out everywhere, but the connection was shot after a few months (of daily use). Worth the money, 3 stars.
summary: Stopped working after a few months

reviewText: This is a nice backup cord to use for charging my iPhone. I have a charging station, but occasionally just a brief charge is necessary. I can use it if I'm going to have a lengthy conversation and don't want to worry about running down my battery. The retractible feature makes for easy storage.
bought this 2nd one as i love 1st one so much. it is very well built. such a cheap price!
summary: have had one for years and its solidly built

reviewText: Using it for 3gs and ipad model 1, both recognise it and allow the charging to work. That's all i wanted it for.
My daughter absolutely loved it. I wish I could have been the at Christmas to watch her use it. Very nice

To me this is the best thing since slice cheese.  I love the ability to retract the cable when it is not being used.  I just wish that I could find the same thing for my other items that have cords all over my vehicle.  If you hate the cables everywhere I highly recommend getting this.
Great case for Iphone 3GS. With its leather cover  closing the plastic case, its elegant.One thing I felt is, they wud ve made it little thinner.
...as I recall.  It was a bit slippery.  But functioned well, and saved my phone from damage on a few drops.
This is a very old review since I have since replaced this phone, but the griffin case was awesome, just wish that they had other cases available.

I had a thin plastic covering the back and sides of my iPhone, but it did not fit well and peeled off. So, I bought this Griffin and I really like it. The case has a very nice feel to it and does not show finger prints. I do not care for others made of plastic or rubber. The case adds very little bulk, but it is just enough that it will not fit in my belt case. However, I do not care because this case provides enough protection that I just slip the phone into my pocket. It also comes with a hard plastic screen protector, but I already have a thin plastic cover I use instead. Another nice feature is the ability to use your phone in a charging dock. You simply slide off the bottom part of the case. If you are looking for this type of case then I recommend trying this one.

Mom is about 3 generations behind on iphones (3GS), but she loved this case I bought her.  The original one I got for her started peeling the fake leather up.  This was the same thing, but really cheap.

This is by far the best designed and built case I have ever owned for a phone. I highly recommend it. It ads very little to the form factor of the iPhone, has held up well and looks good. Most folks at first glance can't tell there is a protector on it. Moreover, it is far superior to silicone cases and flip cases in my opinion.When I first unpackaged and slid it onto the phone, I was skeptical that it would stay put or last long. After 3-weeks of this thing being thrown in pockets, on tables as I enter meetings, dropped on the ground a few times, etc. It hasn't lost it's look, grip to the phone or touch. Unlike another reviewer's experience, there's not a scratch on the phone. My wife has the same case on her 3G - same deal. They look just as they did when they came out of the box from the AT&T; store.It allows easy access to the entire screen, there's just enough of an edge on the front to protect it on a face-first drop, but doesn't have the obnoxious 'over cover' on the bottom and top of the front like some other cases, and easy access to all buttons (while also being protected from drops) plus you can dock it if you have one.It is a simple, elegant design that just works.I personally don't like flip cases - just get in the way. I use it too much to have to keep flipping and holding open. Also, I didn't use the included film. I prefer the stick-on kind (takes a few extra minutes, but you don't have to worry about dust, moving around and scratching the screen, etc.)I suspect that I will wear this out eventually so have an extra on hand should Griffin decided (for some strange reason) to quit making these.
summary: Best phone case I have owned across all phones

reviewText: I have not had my iPhone 3G for a long time but I do remember that I only had this a short time before my brother switched it with his because he liked it more.

I purchased this case from BBuy and I have had it for almost a year.  The cheap, thin leather has peeled all the way off and now I just have a sharp and jagged plastic case.  I do not recommend this case as it will also start to loosen over time.  I use the DLO case as it's reliable.I also have a high quality screen protector, which IMHO, is the most important protection you can put on an iphone.  Whatever case you end up getting, get a high quality screen protector...As far as this case goes, I'm looking to replace it with something very lean so I can still put the phone in the DLO...as you can see, I like a few layers of protection for my beloved iphone!

Just got this case in from Amazon and going to cautiously give it 4 stars. I might go higher after I spend time with it. I have been thru MANY iphone cases trying to find the best one. I think I was a little obsessive about it.Avoid all the silicone / rubber cases, they look nice, they grip well but they ALL stretch some over time. What starts our as a snug glove - tight fit loosens a lot until it squishes around the unit like its made 1 size too big. The hard shell case is the way to go. they don't stretch. Try to get one with a "grippy" surface as opposed to the slick ones that make the iphone prone to flying out of your hand.The Pros - fits perfectly, bottom locks into the top and you have one seamless fit. It says you can take the bottom off to dock but I bet this will fit in my Sony clock radio just fine as ia. Nice grip-able leather surface & feels good to hold. The sides are just shallow enough to not get in the way of your fingers as you type but enough that if you turn it face down the glass won't be touching the surface. The cut outs for the top and side buttons is well done, your fingers find the buttons easily without looking.The Cons: Just the weird poly-carbonate shield it ships with. It might turn out to be awesome but I am used to the very clingy type of stick-on shield. This one is much thicker and you can take it off and re-apply. There's a lot of glare caused by this new shield and it seems to attract prints more. I guess the upside is I can take it off and wash it and put it back on. I will say tho, while looking at the iphone straight on I can't really see any difference. Its mainly when looking at it from the side or when its off. Anyways, I can easily buy some regular press on screens if I don't like this one but I like the idea of thicker and re-useable.Its also a little tricky when you slide the bottom on to make sure the screen cover and such are all in the right grooves, its that reason I'd prefer to not take the bottom off any more than I have to.So, wow - maybe my search for the perfect case is over. Now to ebay all those other cases.

This case was really nice to hold and was really pleasing to the touch. It also came with a screen protector which was easy for me to apply maybe because I've watched people do it many times before. Just Youtube it and you'll be fine. Just make sure not to constantly slide it on and off because the bottom will eventually be too easy to slide off and come off in your pocket or purse or something. Left all ports, side buttons and switches open to use while still being protective.

I purchased this on the clearance aisle so I didn't expect the thing to last forever. The texturing on the back is nice and the fit is snug, however I had a couple of annoying problems with it.1. The fit is a little *too* snug on the top piece and the bottom piece never quite slid on completely, leaving a gap of about 2 millimeters between the top and bottom, which got caught on my jeans going in and out of my pocket.2. The thin piece of plastic on the bottom piece that goes over the front is flimsy, and eventually developed a crack (then an outright break) from just taking the phone in and out of my pocket. I never dropped it once and the bottom half broke within a few months.3. As others have noted, the texturing on the back comes loose in time and it developed little bubbles on the back after a few weeks where the adhesive had given way.I paid less than $20 for the case, and for that price I can't complain much. However it would have been nice if it had lasted longer than a few months.

I ordered this case for my dad...needed a professional look. When I received it, I was more than happy with the product. I also received it much sooner than was expected. I am very happy with the overall experience.
Griffin cases are great and so is this one. At the price you can't go wrong. It's sleek and slim and looks amazing on the phone.
Good quality and a good buy for the price. Hard to find a good qulaity items for Iphone3. The case it self looks like leather but its not its fake leather. Which doesnt bother me.
The rubberized leather started to peel off the corner and any dirt that gets inside scratches the back.  I've started to let my iPhone go naked instead of subjecting it to this fat torture chamber.

I have had two previous versions of this Speck case, and this one has got to be the ugliest and strongest. The rubberized case is huge, but provides fantastic protection to the iPhone 3GS against drops. I absolutely love that they have finally made a way to flip the bottom of the case back so you can place the phone in the dock. For expensive items like iPods, iPhones, etc., I *always* use a protective case, and none of the cases I have had ever allowed using a dock. This one does.The clip (removable) also serves as a stand for viewing vertical or horizontal stuff (like movies!). GREAT!The removable clip/holster evolves a bit from past incarnations, and has two protruding "wings" on the side I really do not like, and I am not sure what they are for. The only guess I have is that if you drop it IN the case, and it lands screen down, those protrusions protect it from hitting the screen. That might be worthwhile.The back of the clip has a clamp that swivels/rotates, AND it pops up -- I have snagged it a few times and instead of breaking the clip, it popped off -- that's much better than needing to replace the clip (like I have had to do on my Blackberry case three times so far).The one thing I did not like was how the swivel clip is not centered like on past models -- so if you put the clip upside down (so you have access to the dock connector for charging) it sets up differently (different angle) than if you have it the other way. It still lets you put it on the side for watching movies. That's really my only gripe so far.

I've had this case for over 6 months now and it's been a life saver.  The extra cushion on the corners has saved my iPhone 3g multiple times.  And we're talking a fall from the kitchen counter to a tile floor.  Definitely protects the phone.The belt clip is pretty much worthless.  The prongs that hold the case extend out and catch on just about everything that I brush past.  So I've stopped using the belt clip.  So if you need a phone case with a belt clip, don't get this one.
summary: Great case so long as you don't wear the phone on your belt...

reviewText: Super protection for iPhone. Who has a 3 anymore? But there are updates for the newer models. It looks like I go for the super protection for my iPhones. It works.

after dropping my phone several times I decided I needed a better case to save my expensive investment!  Easy to install and easy to maintain. This phone provides a sturdy rubber case and is smart looking too. cant go wrong with this one.
Thick enough to surely work in a drop. The clip/mounting accessory is removable which is a good thing. I may never need it.

This is the best case for people who dont like to use a belt pouch. I dont like the belt clip it came with, but to be fair I dont like any belt clip, it does have a kick stand feature that pretty cool but I dont care because I dont use it. The case itself is the best protection you could use for your phone. Easy to put on and if your like me ( Clumsy ) you will sleep better at night knowing your phone is safe. If only my other stuff had such protection.OTTERBOX DEFENDER SERIES 3G IPHONE CASE BLACK/YELLOW This link will bring you to the absolute best cast for your iPhone 3g/3gs
This is a good case for a man that fumbles for his phone and drops it once in a while.  The case grips well and allows me to place then phone on my dash without it sliding about.

reviewerName: P. Colin McGraw "AV, Computer & EnviroTech Nut"
reviewText: The main reasons you'd want to get this case is for the ability to dock your iPhone while keeping the case on (an unfortunate rarity with cases) and for the unmatched drop protection accomplished by the larger than average rubber case which even extends slightly past the screen of the iPhone in case you drop it face down. Toughskin gives you pretty good confidence that your expensive toy is going to be protected, and the design is comfortable and easy to grip.The only downsides worth mentioning is that the belt clip is nice enough, but off-center in a horizontal orientation, and the case is the bulkiest I've seen. Of course, the bulk is sort of the point, since it gives better protection than other cases, but be aware of the size if you like a smaller style. Also, the design of the case makes it difficult to reach the silence switch, use the home button, and touch the edges of the screen because the case sticks out so much. You get used to it, though.Lastly, while this case provides the best-seeming drop protection of any case I've seen, it does nothing about scratch protection for your screen, so make sure you pick up ascreen protector, too.In summary, I think this is one of the best iPhone 3G/3GS cases out there. The drop protection is the best, it comes with a belt clip capable of harnessing the bulky case, and I think it's definitely worth the extra few dollars you'd pay over competing products.
summary: Excellent Protection, But Get a Screen Protector Too.

reviewText: My 6 year old son recently inherited my iPhone 3GS when I bought the iPhone 4 and the 3GS became his glorified iPod Touch. The 3GS had previously had a Speck Candyshell case which was perfect for me because it was tough & had a smooth outside for easy sliding into pockets. The Candyshell was not perfect for the boy who quickly snapped the thin bottom rail on the case which is a common weak spot on the Candyshell. The Toughskin is perfect for him. It looks really cool like car tires, its very hefty & rugged, it provides good coverage on the face, and it doesn't have the flaw the Candyshell did. This case is big & it doesn't slide easily into pockets but it suits my son's purposes perfectly. The finish is not sticky like a lot of silicone cases, for example lint etc doesn't stick to it. It's smooth but the texture catches cloth a little. The case fits snuggly & doesn't interfere with the virtual keyboard (although I don't have big fingers).We will probably never use the belt clip but it looks sturdy and well made. As far as the seller, we got the Toughskin for the lowest price I could find online on 8/19/11, with free USPS shipping & it arrived in perfect condition on 8/26/11. We were very satisfied all around.

My original 2007 Speck toughskin case finally wore out after several years of successfully protecting the phone. Initially I was disappointed that the 2007 model was discontinued. Bought this current model after checking out several others. Totally pleased. Photo looks a little bulkier than the case actually is once you have it on the phone. Like the original, excellent grip, good 'traction'. I'm not having any trouble accessing buttons or the control screen.Speck's a quality manufacturer. Very pleased and I would recommend this case to anyone looking for maximum protection for their iphone. I'm happy to say I have no problem slipping this case into a jeans pocket...again, not as bulky as it looks in the photos.
summary: Great protection, not as bulky as the photo

reviewText: The case itself is fantastic, as many reviewers have said.  Fantastic grip, button access is excellent, and I'm way more confident taking the phone to the store and the gym with this case on.  I really needed a case+belt clip solution, though, and this doesn't seem to cut it.  The belt clip is really flimsy.  It is quite difficult to put on and off the belt, and I'm pretty sure the clip will break very soon.  The holster itself is also flimsy, and if you wear it with your shirt on the outside (not tucked into pants), there is a big piece of plastic that digs into your skin from the back of the clip.  I may keep this for now just for the case, but will have to keep looking for a viable case+clip solution.
summary: Case is awesome, belt clip not so much.

reviewText: Hey, I have this product and I definitly think its tops, as do many of the other people here.  I have one quick recomondentation though for anyone having a problem with it being to grabby and hard to pull out of pockets.  A quick trip to your local auto parts store and pick up a can of clear coat spray paint, about $2.00, and give the case 2, light coats..let it dry and put the phone back in..boom, all the massive protection without the anyoying pulling it out of the pocket problem.  Props to speck, they make awesome products
summary: No slip problem fixed w/ clear coat

reviewText: Good case but it is flimsy and stretched out over time. I'm keeping it for a backup case though.

About as thin as can be and still work to protect in case of a drop. Others are stronger but also thicker. As with most things in life, there is a trade off. My wife likes it because it still easily fits in her pocketbook. A thicker version would not.
summary: Thin but enough to protect. Nice compromise.

reviewText: Loved this new iPhone skin. It felt so nice and slips on and off easily. BUT the iPhone button is not easy to press and I have now moved to other skins where, even though they cover the iPhone button, an easy press can activate it, so it's my second choice for skin and I switch into it sometimes when I feel sportish :)!
summary: Nice grip and material nice to touch. iPhone button not easy to press

reviewText: I like the case, but it has a funny smell that gives me a headache.  I had to send it back.

The item is way too large for the Verizon iphone 4.  It does not fit snug enough and you could almost fit another phone in this case.  The front part of the case open up because its too big causing dirt and other materials to get into the case.

First, the pros! I've been using this case for about 2 months now and I originally made the decision to purchase it based on several factors. I wanted a case that was going to offer as much coverage as possible. There doesn't seem to be another iPhone case on the market that does the job quite as well as the Pixel Skin. Having kids and pets and just general craziness on a daily basis, I hugely appreciate that all of the buttons on the phone are completely covered yet still very accessible. I even feel that the buttons are easier to push with this case in place as you don't have to push as hard to get a response. It was very important to me that the buttons be protected from gunk build up from little hands, being in pockets, etc and I'm very pleased that this gives me that security 100%. This is the only case I've seen (excluding the very expensive Otterbox) that covers the home button. Love it! I have dropped my phone twice and it is just fine, in large part due to this case, I'm sure. It has a very nice tactile grip and I can comfortably hold it in one hand and text, access calendar, shopping list, etc without fear of it slipping out of my hand.And now the cons. I have a kind of love/hate relationship with the texture. While it is soft and grippy and durable, it is also a total lint magnet, but the great thing about that is the case is extremely easy to remove and a quick rinse in the sink (and thorough dry after, of course!) is enough to get it clean again. But be prepared, if it's kept in a pocket a lot and especially if you have pets, it will attract lots of little bits of yuck. It also can be a bit of a nuisance to pull out of a pocket, especially if you wear more fitted pants like I do. The good side to that, however, is that it is less likely to fall out of your pocket! So, like I said, it's a love/hate thing. ;) The only other minor issue I have with this case is it's bulk. It does add significant bulk to the case but it is justified. You are getting much more shock absorption from this case than you would with a hard slim line case. So while it's not the prettiest case in the world, in my opinion, it is definitely some of the best protection for your iPhone available, and at a great price to boot.If you're going for pure looks, want less bulk and aren't as concerned about drops/kids/pets, you would probably be happier with a slider case such as the ones from Casemate.
Yes, it's a little bulky in your pocket, but it has a very snug fit, and really good shock absorption.  I'm not at all scared to let my 2 yr. old play with it now!

I am impressed with the quality of this case - it is sturdy and easy to grip. I love the color. The cutouts are all smoothly done with NO snags. I put it in and take it out of my purse with no problem.I trust this to protect my iPhone.That is why my 4th generation nano also sports a pixelskin case.Worth the investment for the peace of mind it brings.
summary: great investment to protect my iPhone 3g

reviewText: This is a really nice case- Very cushy feeling and fits perfect- Love the bright green color too! Perfect for my Iphone! ;0
summary: Love the color, and great protection for my phone

reviewText: Good:This case is so thick and rubbery that you can drop it (with an iPhone) on the floor and it will bounce. In terms of protecting your iPhone, you probably won't find a better product.With this case, your iPhone will never slip out of your pocket (this is also a negative).All of this at a great price.Bad:This case doesn't look very good unless you like holding something that looks like a grenade.It is really hard to pull your iPhone out of your pocket with this case (this is also a positive).The case's grooves are a lint and dust magnet, though you won't really notice if you get one in black.This case makes your iPhone a lot thicker.Some head phone jacks will no longer fit into your iPhone.

I had the OtterBox Impact case before this one and it was quite flimsy in the inside corners by the screen. Mine finally ripped out in two places there and I had to buy this one. This one is much more solid and I think it looks better. Lots of protection for the phone especially in on the outside corners. Fits the phone nice and snug. I had 2 cases that would turn my ringer off during handling causing me to miss calls. This one seems to be free of that defect. I don't think you could ask for something thinner and still have the protection that this has. It's still slim enough to fit in my t-shirt pocket. Finish is rubbery enough to stop it from sliding and to keep it in your hands.

I've been through a bunch of cases for my 3GS, none of them totally wonderful, until I found this Speck case.  WOW!  It fits nicely, I can use all my various cords and plugs with it, and it looks pretty nifty, too.  It fits nicely into the pocket in my purse, too.  I've only dropped the phone once since I got it, but it worked just fine -- no damage to the phone.I've had no problem with crud getting between the case and the phone -- no scratching, etc.  I've had it about 3 months so far, and it's looking great.If continues to perform this well, I may get another one in another color.

This is just as shown and described in the picture, it's a great product, love the color, that's what caught my eye, bright! It does the trick and I got it at a great price! Would recommend to anyone! Great seller!

I love this silicone cover. it is great protection for my phone.The hole for the headphone jack is a bit small if you're planning to usethe bigger kind of headphone jacks but its ok for the regular hands freeheadset. I just took it to my local shoe repair shop and had him punch a biggerhole where the original headphone hole was. Came out great and I tipped himcouple of box. Maybe you can do the same and use it with any headphone you want.This cover also gives it a nice amount of traction so your phone will mot slipright out of your hand.Get it. you will like it.The shipping was also timely.

Previous to using this case, I had been using a hard plastic case.  I had shied away from the silicone sleeves because of their tendency to pick up dust and lint.  However, after one too many drops and having my hard case open up and come apart, I decided to make the jump to silicone.I love this case.  My phone fits snugly and feels very well protected.  Murphy's Law is in action here, and I haven't dropped it since switching, but I am confident it would handle much better than a rigid case.The silicone on this case is also a bit harder and less tacky than others, so it picks up less dirt.  It doesn't slide in and out of your pocket quite as easy as the iPhone by itself or one in a hard case, but that is a pretty minimal complaint.You can feel confident in this purchase.As a side note, this will not fir a 1st generation iPhone (my wife has the 1st gen and I tried it on just to see).
summary: Great protection all the way around

reviewText: protects phone well.  Negative -the case gets stuck in pocket and peels off of the phone.  Positive - Case doesn't allow phone to slip on counters or tables

The purple was not what I expected from the pictures on Speck's site. The picture on Amazon is a better match. It is not a deep purple like I was hoping for.Looks aside, it is my favorite case so far. The silicone doesn't seem to be losing its stretch and does not pick up dirt like some of my other cases. I love how it covers the buttons and makes them even more responsive than without the case. When I take the case off the buttons feel "dead" compared to the experience with the case.What sets this case apart from many others is the button cover on the front. Despite the all around coverage, the audio and sync ports are easily accessible even with the case on.The silicone is dense and provides excellent protection. I am so clumsy I would not carry my iPhone without a case because I drop it constantly. I have dropped it many times with this case on and the case and phone both still look like new.The silicone also provides light moisture protection and gives me a better overall grip on the phone. I just wish they offered colors other than white and black that were more sophisticated.I would definitely buy this again, just in a different color.
summary: Great Case, Less Than Great Purple

reviewText: This is simply the best case money can buy.  See one yourself before you buy any other.  You will see that the thick rubber material covers the ENTIRE phone through out, not just on the back, and the raised edges along the screen side provide a thick cushioniong and depth of protection, should your phone be dropped on this side.  (while still not hindering any typing or screen space)  Some other cases, like ones with "rigid interior skeleton" surrounded by "some rubber"?  That is pointless for the protection of dropping a phone.  That rigid skeleton would only be beneficial for protection against slolwly applied even pressure, like if you were to put ur phone in a vice and slowly tighten it.  This is not the application of protection you need.  You want cushion and spring so that when the phone drops, the case will absorb as much of that velocity as possible, providing the phone a soft landing.  That is is exactly what this case does, and I have not found a better made one out there.
summary: Hands down most protective case you can buy

reviewText: The Satechi battery extender is well-made, portable and easy to use.  After two weeks of "testing", this device consistently provided 2 full charges plus a 75% partial charge for my 2G iPod Touch.  While I am satisfied with the extra usage time, I can't give the Satechi a 5-star rating because it comes with no external charger.  Using Apple's USB charger is an overnight process.  And charging thru my MacBook Pro gave a "drawing too much power" warning."  Nevertheless, I am satisfied with the extra charge I get when there's no external power outlet handy.  If you need a spare battery that also charges your iPod or iPhone, this device is definitely worth buying.
summary: A Power Outlet Away from Home

reviewText: The form factor and capacity of this product are impressive, and it is a well made device.It would not charge my iPhone 5, however.  That's why this product loses a star.This Powerstation will work well for those of you who own older devices and don't plan to upgrade anytime soon, but otherwise you may want to consider another Satechi Power Station that is compatible with the devices available today.To the seller's credit they took my return no questions asked, with a quick refund.

This product does what is expected, charges my Galaxy S2 phone about 1.5 times from a full charge. I do wish it did a bit more. One of the bigger problems I have with this is that it can only be charged from a computer. i thought this wouldn't be much of a problem but I recently had a problem where I didn't have a computer on hand to charge it overnight, but I could have easily plugged it into a wall. If you can get over that, it's a good product. Granted I have only had it for a month, but I've used it about every other day an d no problems yet.

I just got back from my first business trip where I needed my 3GS iPhone to last more than the normal 8-10 hours of extended use before recharging.  This little guy came in handy when I was able to re-charge my phone when I didn't have access to a normal power supply.  If you're looking for a reliable recharger that will fully charge your phone 2 or 3 times before needing a recharge itself, this is the charger for you.  Thanks Satechi for a GREAT and useful product!

I used this on a long 20+ hour flight (multiple connecting flights) and it recharged my phone fine on the first flight. But then it could only recharge it partially on my second (connecting) flight. I recharged it overnight in the hotel at my first destination before going on a long bus ride, and it wouldn't fully charge my phone while enroute to my second destination. That's been my experience with this thing since then.The 5200 mAh is very overrated. Maybe like 3000 mAh when new, and much less after it's been used a couple of times.This is my experience from 2011. It's been stored in a drawer for over year, and I found it while cleaning up and finally decided to review it.Junk, stay away.
Had a 11 hour car ride out of state, used this to charge both my iphone and my wife's while on the road on the way up and back with ease.

I purchased this in January 2011 and >1 year later it is still working dependably and consistently.  In that time, I've used it regularly, mostly when I travel or when i decide to commute rather than drive to work.  I've re-charged to 100% from full depletion 3-8 times a month, depending on my travel schedule.  I've successfully charged many different devices - Samsung Captivate, Blackberry Curve 3G, Jabra BT earpiece, IPhone 3G and 3GS, and Ipod classic.  It has enough capacity to fully charge 2-3 phones from 10-15%, which are typically the captivate, an iphone 3gs, and the BB PLUS my BT earpiece. After this, i would need to recharge.I've successfully recharged this battery using many different branded USB cords and different wall chargers; specifically, the wall chargers tend to output 750mA (BB) or greater (Iphone charger is 1A and a generic one i have is 1A too).Update 22Apr'2013:  This is still working very well and i am pleased to announce that i have used it successfully also on: Samsung Galaxy S3 (i747 / AT&T;'s version), iPhone 5, Jawbone Icon (BT earpiece).  I recently tried it on my wife's IPad 3 (last version with the 30-pin connector) and it was SLOW, but over 3hrs, there seemed to be a net rise in the battery charge level .  I still would not use it as the primary charger for an iPad.
summary: Works on multiple gadgets - Samsung Captivate, Blackberry Curve 3G, Jabra BT earpiece, ipod classic, Iphone 3G & 3GS

reviewText: I bought this battery pack because I routinely run the battery on my iPhone down below 20%. I did not want to buy a battery-in-a-case solution such as the Mophie Juicepack because I have read many reviews that point to the fact that these battery-case solutions can significantly dampen the phone's ability to receive signal. The Satechi pack is a small battery that allows me to recharge my iPhone on the fly up to two times before it needs recharging, and it's relatively small footprint means I can carry it anywhere I go. Charging it can take over an hour. Just make sure you use a powered USB hub, or, of using a laptop, make sure you use the main USB port, that draws more power. If not, you will not be able to recharge the pack to full charge, and it will overheat the USB cord quickly. Finally, you can use the iPhone's own charger to recharge the battery, but only the old style, larger charger. The newer, smaller charger (sold with the newer iPhone 3GS) is not powerful enough to handle the power draw of the battery pack as it charges, and all it will do is overheat significantly while the indicator lights on the battery flash and the battery never really charges, which can potentially be a problem. So make sure whatever USB adapter you use to charge the battery has enough power output and draw to allow the pack to charge safely.

Mine looked as good as new and seemed to be complete, but the seals on the package had been broken when I received it.  It was pretty obviously something that had been returned but that's not a big deal to me (if it had been underwear or something I might have been concerned).  Anyway, it arrived nearly fully charged (four out of five lights) when I plugged it into a USB port on my laptop.  So I plugged the output from the Satechi into my Nook Color and lo and behold, the Nook proprietary cable lit up and it started charging away.  I turned on a video and let it play while the Satechi charged it and the Nook charge was increasing consistently the whole time.Then I disconnect the Satechi from my laptop so that it was no longer being powered.  Oops.  In less than five seconds the Nook cable's charging light turned off.  I pressed the status button on the Satechi (which is supposed to briefly light the indicators so you can see how much juice you have left) and nothing...no lights at all.  The Nook started discharging normally.I plugged the Satechi back into my laptop and all the status lights lit back up, as well as the Nook cable's charging light.  Bottom line: the Satechi was obviously charged, but wouldn't send a charge to the Nook unless the Satechi itself was being powered.  Kind of defeats the purpose.  If I hadn't gotten what appeared to be used goods I would have returned it for another - it sounds like a great thing - but decided against bothering with that and just returned it.
summary: Mine was defective; I suspect it had been returned

reviewText: I own tons of external batteries for my Apple devices.  As far as I am concerned, this is the best battery you can buy for the money.  This is my fifth battery from Satech (my first white battery) and I like it so much... I bought the company... just kidding.  But I really really like their batteries.  They charge fast, hold their charge long, priced right, compact and sort of light weight, looks great, well made, prove great customer service, and they do the job.  What else do you want?

This little thing is amazing & makes our life so much easier. I use my HTC HD2 24/7 & was looking into an extended battery. I came across this top notch charger & decided to give it a try. I used it to keep both an HD2 & an ATT Fuze alive during a trip to pick up a puppy. It simply amazed me how many charges we got off of it & how fast it charged. Then after rearranging the living room I realized I would have to run a charger through the middle of the room....no way with a puppy. This has now become the only charger we use no matter where we are, car, home, work it goes everywhere. And the nice bag thats included is an absolute plus on making it convienent. And men, yes you would use this bag, it's not girly. So far I have kept both phones (heavily used)alive for about 2 days & have let it sit 3-4 days before there was no charge left.Only flaw I can find is VERY minor, even with a complete charge, after unplugging it from my computer it instantly drops from 5 lights to 4. But from what I can tell it doesn't appear to be short of a full charge at all. I contacted Satechi to make sure the light issue wasn't a defect & they did say the lights aren't always 100% accurate. But I would guess 99.9% is accurate. This is a powerhouse charger!1 strange thing that again is nothing but I tend to go a little O.C.D. sometimes. It's a black charger that comes with a white cord LOL. I'm getting ready to buy the white charger & can't wait to see what color that cord is. But it being white does make it easier to spot :-)And by the way Satechi.....it would be great if you offered the white one eligible for my Amazon Prime shipping method!
summary: I LOVE IT!! A MILLION TIMES BETTER THAN AN EXTENDED BATTERY FOR MY HTC HD2!!

reviewText: *** IMPORTANT: This battery only properly charges from a laptop USB port.  DO NOT attempt to use with a car charger, wall charger, etc. unless you confirm that it puts out ONLY 500 mA, and no more.  See [UPDATE] section below, for more details. ***[Capacity summary: was able to (carefully!) charge my Droid X **which has an extended internal battery with 20% more capacity** 1.3 times.  If product worked as advertised, I should have been able to charge at least 2.3 times, assuming my Li-ion phone battery is at the poor end of the charging-efficiency spectrum.  Would expect at least 2.7 charges for Droid X with regular (non-extended) internal battery.]Overall design is very nice; it looks very nice, shape is good, very attractive.  But... several problems.First, this battery was supposed to be in 'new' condition, but was very clearly (and heavily) pre-used; the box had stains, sticky stuff, and extra circular stickers on it (from where the previous 'owner' broke the seal).Second, it didn't work.  My phone (Droid X with genuine Motorola extended battery BH6X, which holds 1800 mAh instead of the usual 1500) could only charge from it a total of about 1.3 times, before the external battery was totally drained.  I was surprised, so I repeated the test, and got the same results.  I was super careful: I let the external battery charge for 36 hours; I waited til my phone was down to 30%; then I charged it up to 100% (cell was on; gps/wireless off; all tasks killed; screen off/no activity).  I then disconnected the external battery right away, when the phone reached 100%.I then repeated the process; I plugged the phone into the external battery at 30%.  About two hours later, it was at 70%, but the external battery was 100% drained.Very disappointing performance.  It was only able to transfer 45% of its alleged  energy to the Droid X (1800 x 1.3 = 2340 mAh, out of 5200), but Wikipedia says that Li ion should be able to charge at 80-90% efficiency -- so something is clearly wrong here.I would stay away; I was worried when I bought it, noticing that many recent reviews (as of April 2011) had complained of the same.  I think they're selling a bunch of their returned units.  This really irks me, as I'm extremely busy, and really don't have time for this kind of stuff; I want to just buy a product that works and lasts, and I'm happy to pay whatever it takes.[UPDATE]Satechi contacted me.  They claim that smart phone chargers provide too many amps, and that this fries the external battery.  They recommend *only* charging from a laptop (where the USB is limited to 0.5A), whereas I used (in my two tests) chargers with 850 and 1000 amps.However, this is no excuse; this is a design defect.  You should be able to charge from any source, as long as it has at least 500 mA.  Every other electronics device on the planet has circuitry to limit the amperage it takes in to what it needs, and gracefully rejects excess current.  They tried very hard over the phone to convince me that this was not a design defect; I found this very disingenuous.  Review remains at 1 star... sorry, Satechi.[/END UPDATE]
summary: Was not 'new'; didn't work as advertised.

reviewText: First Look: Arrived in a very nice box, unit is shining new, nice carrying pouch, USB cable. A+ for presentation and could be a very good gift for someone special. Unit came pre-charged but follow instructions... charge it for a minute or so before use. After that, it's as simple as plug it in. Fast charged my HTC EVO 4G from almost empty to full in a very short time... sorry forgot to time the charging time because I was overly excited over this new toy. After that I charged it using an AC-USB charger until all 5 green LED's are lit. Concept: Neat and Concise. The battery extender could also be charged by a computer via its USB cable. Then the same USB cable could be flipped over to charge the phone; in my case, I had to use an additional mini USB to micro USB charging adapter. So 1 cable, 1 bat-ext, 1 adapter, all in a single pouch. A+ for compact. A+ for simplicity and nice touch on the little status button that tells you how much juice is left. Industrial Design: Clean line and 'Apple' like although the enclosure squeaks a little when it's being squeeze. And because of the shining effect, expect fingerprints magnet! Buff the prints off using the soft case, and it looks marvelous! Overall, well built and no gap, which show excellent workmanship and attention to details. Markings are sharp and no blemish found. Don't know about how safe it is as there is no UL Listing Mark on it; could be a concern for a rechargeable Li-Ion battery, which is known to go 'Kaboom' when being over-charged. Has some weight feel to it...feel like it's stocky! Good, I am expecting beefy juice out of this bad boy!Since it's full charge 8 days ago, it now has lost one green LED without being used. Assuming that the unit discharges linearly, it would take 8*5=40 days to completely discharge... Recognizing that this a false assumption and theoretically at best, so don't go jumping all over me now! I will give the unit another 8 days to check if it would lose another LED. Then loading and cycling tests of the unit will begin. Stay tune.Update Jan 2013 - After 2 years of using this device, it has paid for itself many times over. The battery appears to reach it's life cycle so I have to charge it more often to ensure I have backup power while traveling. It's still a nice unit when it was introduced at the time... simple to use, just remember to plug it in the night before your trip to have a full charge ready for use.... today there are many similar options to choose from other companies, and there are newer models from the same company... worth a second look.

I like it.  Very easy to pair.  The plastic loop does fall off easily, I just superglued it to the headset and that solved the problem.  Assuming the environment is quiet, the people can hear me well. Otherwise, it's way too noisy. I can hear other people without any issues.  I give it 4 stars because of its lack of ambient noise cancellation features.

This bluetooth is great! The battery life is very good. Lasts all day using it and for several days if you use it here and there. It's comfy even after various hours, EXCEPT if you don't put it on right! Make sure that the earhook part that is connected to the earpiece (little bump) isn't touching your ear! If it does it could somewhat bother you, besides that, it's light, comfy, and small! Highly recommended to those who need a bluetooth at an affordable price
summary: Good looks, sound, and fit... All for a low price

reviewText: I like this product, as I like most samsung headsets.  They do not have the annoying crackling that I get from most other cheap headsets.  The one drawback is it doesn't have a dedicated on/off switch like other models.
I had one then my oldest son wanted one. Useful for on the go and when you drive all day for work you will be ready to have hands off talking and still be safe.

Connects quick to my phone, but calls are dropped. Makes a weird high pitch squeel while it charges. The charger is not mini usb which means you have to use the proprietary one (negative imo). I got it for $-3 after a rebate. I'm happy getting paid $3 to buy this headset. Good shipping.Update: I didn't get the rebate so $23 for a pretty bad bluetooth. It is the only one I have that works currently. Callers complain about lots of noise on my end. The controls are pretty bad and I cannot use for voice commands with HTC Incredible.

I also have the Samsung WEP 200 which works well the microphone doesn't pick up too much noise and the speaker gets plenty loud.  The WEP 301 can't be used in some cars at highway speeds because it picks up too much noise.  It is almost as if there is no frequency filter.There are good things about it.  The wire for your ear can be adjusted to fit.  The headset comes with several different ear attachments.  There are some "fun skins" you can add to it.I got this headset assuming it would be at least as good as the WEP 200.  It isn't.
summary: Too quiet and poor microphone or frequency-filter quality

reviewText: It works nice for the price. Looks neat in the ear, has great sound and the stickers make it look cute

I got this for my wife so she'd have something to use in her car to make driving while talking a little easier. After trying it for a couple of days we returned it because we were unhappy with the sound quality on the OTHER end.THE GOOD:1. It's very small and light, and very comfortable. It fit both of us very nicely, and we both have freakishly small ears.2. Pairing with the phone (iPhone) was easy, but I'm beginning to think that pairing is very seldom an issue with bluetooth headsets.3. The sound quality (speaker on the headset) was good.THE BAD:1. The only really bad thing, and ultimately the reason we returned it, is that the person on the other end had difficulty understanding what you were saying. My wife (the one using the Samsung WEP 301) always sounded very distant, tinny, and staticy. I thought it may be because I was listening to her on my bluetooth device (plantronics discovery 925), but other people had the same complaint. I frequently was having to ask her to repeat herself. WE got tired of this, so we returned it and bought a Jabra 4010.As far as comparison to a similarly priced headset, the Jabra 4010 is much better, in my opinion. While it doesn't fit as deeply in the ear as the Samsung, the sound quality on both ends is great. When my wife is using it, I can't tell a difference between her using the headset and her using the phone.If you had to choose between the two devices, I'd go with the Jabra 4010 easily...even if it is more expensive (which we paid the same price for both of them).
summary: You get what you pay for (too cliche?)

reviewText: My main complaint isn't different from anyone else's really.  The part that hangs onto your ear is made of a thin plastic, and I can see how it'd easily break.  I worry about transporting it inside my purse.  It's redeeming quality is that sound is good.  Not bad for something that costs slightly more than 10 smackeroos!

I own quite a few bluetooth headsets: Motorola, Jabra, Plantronics, and this one.  This own is by far the most clear, unencumbersome, comfortable set.  I own this many headsets as others did not work well with my cell phone or was uncomfortable wearing them.  Well, this one works like a charm.  I have always found the bluetooth to be very encumbersome in the past.  They stick out like a sore thumb due to it's size and comfort.  This one I don't even notice I am wearing it.  The calls are clear and I recommend it to anyone that is skittish or on the fence about getting one.  Cant beat the price either.
This is junk. I have never had one sound so bad. It doesn't even hold a charge for very long

A lot of people say that if you don't have steady hands or it's a love or hate thing because some people get it done perfect and some don't.  I really disagree.  This is one of the easiest screen protectors to apply and I've tried MANY brands.  I've spent over $100 on different screen protectors of all types, mirror, glossy, privacy, and just regular like this one.  Zagg was the one I first ever bought, and I decided to stray away because I wanted something cool like the privacy, then the mirror, then so on and so on.  I've come back to Zagg twice on one device (and used it on three different devices (iPhone, another iPhone, and iPod Touch)).  Point is, I can't find anything better.It's actually really easy, especially if you follow the directions.  It's a lot easier to get Zagg on the screen and eliminate bubbles than any other because the screen protector is soft.  It's not a stiff piece of material.  You don't need steady hands because if you put plenty of the spray supplied on your fingers (prevent fingerprints very well this way) and on your screen (but not to drown your phone) and on the sticky part of the screen protector, you should be able to place it on the screen and basically slide it around until it's in the right position you want it.  The key is using the spray plentifully (it won't damage your phone unless you basically pour the whole thing on it).I've done this so many times and each time it takes me less than 10 minutes to get it on perfect, no air bubbles not lint underneath, it's just great.  Other screen protectors I always catch lint under it and get awful bubbles and have to redo it for about 30 minutes at a time.  The squeegee is actually a squeegee it's not a piece of plastic like others provide so it actually pushes the solution out properly and gets all the bubbles out.  So it's really good quality.I really recommend getting this for iPhone because at one time I had it for over a year before I decided to get another screen protector just because I wanted to try something new, not because it was peeling off or anything.  It was still in tact and looked brand new.One thing I would not recommend though is the Zagg full body shield.  It's really bad honestly.  I could never get it on without having bubbles or misaligned because the iPhone 3G has curves which make it hard to make it stick on.  It eventually sticks on after 23 hours (around the corners) but after about 6-10 months the little edges start to peel off and you get really noticeable dirt build up on all edges and underneath the little "arms" that wrap around the corners.  So I did not like that I had to get a replacement for that (which is free with a $4 shipping charge but still it should've lasted much longer than that).  But the front screen protector, I've never had a problem with so I'd highly recommend it.  Don't be scared of the other reviews, just watch the installation guide videos and use plenty of spray and you'll be fine.

I have used the Zagg Shields on 3 different phones and love it. Once you get it on, it stays put. I even clean my screen with my shirt tail without worry of scratching the iPhones screen. However, I only use the shield on the screen, not the whole body of the phone. I found that with the curves of a phone, the Zagg just does not work well. I use a different case instead.FYI. It is very important when placing the shield on the screen to use the spray and a lot of it. Spray your phones screen AND your fingers. The more spray you use the more time you will have to adjust the shield and nudge it into place. And the easier it is to get the bubbles out. If you do not get it right the first time and it starts drying out, you probably did not use enough spray.  Just peal of the shield and start over. Just make sure you spray and spray again.I have tried other shields, but like this one the best by far.

reviewerName: Dusty White "Advanced Tarot Secrets author an...
reviewText: I was hesitant to invest yet another [...] bucks on my iPhone, but the thought of scratching it all up was simply a non-starter, so I took a gamble. This think ROCKS! It's basically two sheets of heavy duty plastic (I want to say mylar, but I am not sure) and you get a high quality squeegee, which of course you only use once--that seems a waste, and a little plastic jar of some liquid that looks strangely like saline solution (But I wasn't brave enough to take a sip). And then some instructions, of course.You clean your iPhone or iPod, peel the plastic sheet and wet it with the mystery water, and carefully apply tit to your phone/pod. It is almost exactly like tinting your own windows. Placement is a bit of a pain, but you can keep trying. It took me three times to place the front, and about seventeen to place the back panel. I see that some people think the cover makes it look cheap, but I would personally rather have a 2% discoloration (mostly psychological anyway) than a SCRATCHED iPhone or iTouch. The small circular plastic dot at the bottom (see product image) can also be applied, but in retrospect I wish I had not.The plastic is nearly invisible, it is super tough, and it acts like a mini-cushion against shock when you accidentally drop your iToy, but I still recommend a sleeve or jacket. When you run your finger along the front screen, it is not as smooth as the glass, but it's something you get used to, and it is definitely better than a scratch you can't repair. I can't recommend this thing enough. It really is worth protecting your $300-$500 investment.Thanks for reading
summary: Save your iPhone--this thing really works!

reviewText: After reading and following the instructions, I installed the Zagg protective shield. It went on cleanly and without any snags. The included squeegee makes smoothing the plastic easy and quick, and the included spray of liquid helped with aligning the precut plastic to fit onto the face perfectly. After waiting over night, the screen protector laid down smooth and tight, no bubbles what so ever.Remember, YOU MUST, read and following the instructions to the letter. If you do this, you will not be disappointed.
summary: does exactly what it was designed to do.....

reviewText: i have been using Zagg products for all my iDevices. It is a headache to get it on right because you have to spray that solution, but once you get it right, it is perfect and your screen is protected against anything. Tough as nail. One time i got a cheaper brand and i can tell the difference right away. Spend more and protect your screen. I love there iPad screen protectors- cost $$ but so worth it.

The delivery was great, earlier than expected. The shield looked as if it was rejected by Zagg for imperfections. It had lines and "stamp" marks that are visible when my iPhone is off, and of course, are invisible when on. Still cheaper than Zagg charges, with no shipping costs.

This is a must have if you are trying to preserve your original iPhone 3GS or 3G. I bought a couple full protection and front protection from the same seller, definitely fast and prompt service... And brand new!
summary: Ordered because its no longer avail in retail stores.

reviewText: This is the best cover for the Iphone. I have the Casecrown glide and it doesnt mess with this shield at all like it does on others. It does take patience to put on and you wanna make sure the surface you are doing it on is super clean because anything around will stick to this thing. But once on its amazing. I can have my keys and my phone in the same pocket and it wont even faze this shield. Also the touch screen is still just as responsive.
summary: Best iphone Shield. And works with Case crown.

reviewText: if your an iPhone owner or any sort of tech gadget owner - this is a purchase you don't want to pass up making. the shield comes in an original ZAGG box, which helps remind u to immediately register your ZAGG product so when the life time warranty on your shield is needing to be used your eligible for obtaining the new shield sent to you in the mail. Also, the shield comes with a microfiber cloth for cleaning off the device before applying the shield, a spray bottle of solution for applying the shield, and a rubber squeegee for pushing the extra solution and air bubbles in the shield out from under the cover. The spray solution used for applying the shield that already has adhesive on its underside works wonders and helps make this the easiest shield to apply to your device on the market currently... I was able to put this shield on my iPhone 3GS in a matter of minutes and did not have a single air bubble at all on my screen unlike other shields I've used where I've spent 30-60mins with my credit card/drivers license trying to push out the air bubbles on my screen..I highly recommend this purchase, its totally worth it - Plus, its got a life time guarantee on free shield replacements for the device and mailed to your home free of charge.

I applied this two night ago and I like the idea of a permanent (we shall see) protector and the way it goes on. I used to have trouble with dry adhesive screen protectors because my case edge would work the edge of the protector up and start it to peel(after +,- a month) , this protector does not seem to do that (yet). I was a little nervous about using a liquid around my iPhone because of Apples sensitive moisture detection system but it went on OK without to much extra fluid. My wife has had this screen protector on her 4 for 2 months and has no complaints. My only complaint is that the feel of the screen is tackier and my fingers don't slide as well. It has a rippled surface instead of a smooth one like many protectors. Like most screen protectors it is overpriced but if it really does last the lifetime of the phone it would be cheaper than the others long term. Read the instructions carefully - it needs to dry undisturbed at least overnight.

When I ordered this Zagg Screen Guard,I figured it was really good becuase there'svideos and people bragging about it.Well I was really dissapointed. Why?Because it's nothing but a piece of rubber.It doesn't look normal on the phone. My fingers didn'tglide accross the screen. And it left to much of aresidue and it was all streaked.Look, just stick with the regular hard screen protectors.There way more dependable and less expensive and comes with more than 1.
summary: Don't Bother, Stick with the Regular Hard Screen Protectors

reviewText: I have used numerous screen protective films since 2003 dating back to my old Palm Tungsten C days.  One of my biggest gripes was the film coming off of the screen, and another gripe was oil and fingerprints accumulating over time.  This protector actually appears to keep those fingerprints off, giving me a clear view when watching videos.  The semigloss finish decreases the excessive glare of the native screen.Application is somewhat awkward since you apply a nonstick spray to the adhesive side and your fingers to minimize fingerprints.  There is a rubber squegy that decreases the 'bubbles' and uneven application of the cover.The tactile feel still allows good sensitivity of the touch screen.A lifetime warranty is somewhat of an oxymoron, given that the phone will likely be replaced in 2-3 years by its user.This is one of the best screen protectors that I have had the chance to use.

I don't understand why there are so many complaints about invisible-shield. If you read the directions it takes about 15-20 minutes to install. It's sturdy as a rock and easy to clean. I like it. The reviews are scary. I watched a review on youtube that was so scary I returned mine. After I read a couple comments here I decided to try again with the thought that if I messed it up, it would be a twenty buck lesson.
